news.title: Temperatures to soar close to 30C over weekend – and public urged to conserve water as 31 areas in ‘drought status’
news.summary: The mercury will soar close to 30C in Ireland over the next four days – but the public is being urged to conserve water as a total of 31 catchment areas across 12 counties are currently in "drought status".

news.title: No prosecution for woman filmed eating carvery after claiming she couldn’t dine out following alleged thumbtack incident in Supermac’s
news.summary: The Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) has decided not to pursue a case against a woman filmed eating a carvery after swearing in an affidavit that she could no longer dine in public after allegedly finding a thumbtack in a chip at a Supermac’s restaurant.

news.title: Surge in ‘big-money’ divorces even as rate of separation falls
news.summary: There was a significant rise in big-money divorce applications last year, bucking the prevailing trend for divorces, which have been decreasing in recent years.

news.title: How much will you get? – how your State pension will be affected by the new system
news.summary: I have been inundated with queries about the contributory State pension, sparked by changes in the way the amount is calculated.

news.title: Martin Breheny: Remembering the great Seán Doherty, ‘The Doc’ who helped cure Dublin football’s ills
news.summary: ‘The Doc’ is dead, and now the task for the Dublin GAA community is to compose a fitting tribute for the part he played in building one of football’s most towering edifices.

news.title: Indo Daily: The crucifix, the marriage cert and the National Ploughing Championship: The Joseph Grogan inquest
news.summary: Joseph Grogan’s farm will be familiar to many, as it has hosted the National Ploughing Championships on several occasions.

news.title: Designer Sonya Lennon: ‘I was threatened with arrest mid-air. There was a garda van waiting on the apron when we got to Dublin Airport’
news.summary: TV presenter, designer and entrepreneur Sonya Lennon is from Co Dublin. A co-founder of homewares brand Lennon Courtney, she is also the founder of WorkEqual, which aims to raise awareness of gender inequality in the workplace. Lennon lives in Dublin with her partner David and their twins, Evie and Finn.

news.title: Eoin McGee answers: ‘I’m in my forties and adding AVCs of almost €1,000 per month to my pension. Is it worth the sacrifice? Should I just enjoy life now?
‘I had a very ill wee boy, now I want to give something back’: Sisters develop ‘Fairy Trail’ for children
news.summary: When Benburb mum Michelle Rooney sat at her living room window telling her son Frankie fairy stories, she felt the spark of an idea to bring a little magic to lots of local families.

news.title: The bridesmaid-zillas: From slagging the bride’s choices, to in-fighting and drunken speeches – how bad bridesmaids almost ruined these Irish weddings
news.summary: The annual wedding season is upon us and brides across the land are either looking forward to or revelling in their big day. What if the problem is the bridesmaid herself? What if she is the one causing grief, creating waves and generally trying to upset the apple cart and upstage the bride?
